response_requirements.initial_response_description: Custodian must permit inspection at reasonable times and furnish copies 'as promptly as possible'
response_requirements.final_response_notes: No specific statutory deadline; must respond 'as promptly as possible' under reasonable supervision

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: No specific provision for search fees in statute
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Actual cost of reproduction ('minimal cost' defined as actual cost)
fee_structure.policy_note: Policy that people may obtain copies free or at minimal cost unless otherwise specifically provided by law

exemptions.description: Confidential communications to attorneys or public boards/officials if required by law, would be confidential to private attorney, or within attorney-client privilege
Confidential tax information required to be kept confidential under G.S. 105-259
Certain economic development records during negotiations
Personal identifying information protected under various provisions

appeal_process.first_level_notes: No formal administrative appeal process; enforcement through court action
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Attorney fees may be available through court action

requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Any person may inspect and examine records; no specific form required

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Custodian of public records designated for each agency
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must provide electronic copies when maintained electronically
agency_obligations.prohibition_on_destruction: Willful destruction without lawful authority is Class 1 misdemeanor
agency_obligations.records_management_required: State agencies must implement electronic records management program

oversight_body.name: Department of Archives and History
oversight_body.role: Records management oversight; must consent to destruction of records
oversight_body.contact_info: State Department of Archives and History

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields manually verified from official North Carolina statute. No specific response deadline - 'as promptly as possible' standard. Actual cost of reproduction (minimal cost policy). Inspection free. Records are property of the people. Willful destruction is Class 1 misdemeanor. Electronic records management required for state agencies. No formal administrative appeal - enforcement through courts. Department of Archives and History provides records management oversight.
